attributes.action: Ban hunting with dogs in northern Ireland
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs have long been used as a method of sport to rip up and kill animals after a prolonged chase to complete exhaustion. It is contradictory to the long held views of the people of Northern Ireland who by large are highly conscious of animal welfare. 

People gaining joy out of the prolonged suffering of a defenders animal is not acceptable and it's time this barbaric practice was put to an end once and for all.
attributes.background: Stop the use of dogs for hunting any and all wildlife. Bring about harsh punishments for those who break these laws.

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Executive and Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for. 

If you want to raise this issue you could contact your MLA, or raise it with the Northern Ireland Executive.

You can find contact details for your MLAs here: http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/your-mlas/

You can find contact details for the departments of the Northern Ireland Executive here: https://www.nidirect.gov.uk/contacts/government-departments-in-northern-ireland
